org.ofbiz.commonapp.security
Class Security

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--org.ofbiz.commonapp.security.Security
public class Security
extends java.lang.Object

Title: Security handler

Description: Security class - contains methods to check security permissions.

Field Detail

personSecurityGroupByUsername

public static UtilCache personSecurityGroupByUsername
Hashtable to cache a Collection of PersonSecurityGroup entities for each Person, by username.

securityGroupPermissionCache

public static UtilCache securityGroupPermissionCache
Hashtable to cache whether or not a certain SecurityGroupPermission row exists or not. For each SecurityGroupPermissionPK there is a Boolean in the cache specifying whether or not it exists. In this way the cache speeds things up whether or not the user has a permission.
Constructor Detail

Security

public Security()
Method Detail

findPersonSecurityGroupByUsername

public static java.util.Iterator findPersonSecurityGroupByUsername(java.lang.String username)
Uses personSecurityGroupByUsername cache to speed up the finding of the person's security group list.
Parameters:
username - The username to find security groups by
Returns:
An iterator made from the Collection either cached or retrieved from the database through the PersonSecurityGroup Helper.

securityGroupPermissionExists

public static boolean securityGroupPermissionExists(java.lang.String groupId,
                                                    java.lang.String permission)
Finds whether or not a SecurityGroupPermission row exists given a groupId and permission. Uses the securityGroupPermissionCache to speed this up. The groupId,permission pair is cached instead of the username,permission pair to keep the cache small and to make it more changeable.
Parameters:
groupId - The ID of the group
permission - The name of the permission
Returns:
boolean specifying whether or not a SecurityGroupPermission row exists

hasPermission

public static boolean hasPermission(java.lang.String permission,
                                    javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
                             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Checks to see if the currently logged in person has the passed permission.
Parameters:
permission - Name of the permission to check.
session - The current HTTP session, contains the logged in person as an attribute.
Returns:
Returns true if the currently logged in person has the specified permission, otherwise returns false.
Throws:
RemoteException - Standard RMI Remote Exception

hasEntityPermission

public static boolean hasEntityPermission(java.lang.String entity,
                                          java.lang.String action,
                                          javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
                                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Like hasPermission above, except it has functionality specific to Entity permissions. Checks the entity for the specified action, as well as for "_ADMIN" to allow for simplified general administration permission.
Parameters:
entity - The name of the Entity corresponding to the desired permission.
action - The action on the Entity corresponding to the desired permission.
session - The current HTTP session, contains the logged in person as an attribute.
Returns:
Returns true if the currently logged in person has the specified permission, otherwise returns false.
Throws:
RemoteException - Standard RMI Remote Exception
